content:
With following command you can print a random string of a certain length on Linux.
tr -dc A-Za-z0-9 </dev/urandom | head -c <length> ; echo '' The string is safe to use in most web contexts such as HTML forms or environment variables.

content:
When hosting Django applications on AWS Elastic Beanstalk, it is often required to run commands on the server to do some maintenance tasks.
Beanstalk provisions EC2 instances which are running the web server processes. Django commands need to run in the same environment.
You might want to fix your shell first.
After connecting using SSH with
eb ssh load the environment variables using
export $(cat /opt/elasticbeanstalk/deployment/env | xargs) then load the Python environment using
source /var/app/venv and finally run your Django command
python /var/app/current/manage.py runserver
summary: When hosting Django applications on AWS Elastic Beanstalk, it is often required to run commands on the server to do some maintenance tasks.
title: Running Django Commands on AWS Elastic Beanstalk
